info.text: [query]I only talk with people with real muscles, you got 'em? data*prSKELETAL_MUSCLE_TISSUE,prSMOOTH_MUSCLE_TISSUE,prCARDIAC_MUSCLE_TISSUE;You don't got enough muscles.
I offer you the gift of knowledge.
The major parts of the muscular system are muscles, specifically cardiac muscles, smooth muscles, and skeletal muscles.
The muscular system is responsible for movement and contractions within the body. These contractions can be voluntary, such as skeletal muscle contractions,
or in voluntary, such as cardiac and smooth muscles.
Smooth muscles from the muscular system line organs, such as those involved in the digestive system (the stomach, the intestines, etc).
The contractions of these muscles are involuntary, but the smooth muscles help the digestive system push the food along the organs so that it can be digested properly.
Bro you just got some knowledge, but now you a nerd ew.
*the man smashes a hole in the floor*
